column4: I used "sudo apt-get install openssh-server" to install a ssh server, and didnt have the time to look at the output and the session became terminated. I looked complete from the glance I took, but there is no ssh port open when I run nmap against the machine
you may have to log into the system and run "apt-get -f install"
or re-install
just apt-get -f install?
when packages get into a half-installed state, yeah
or "apt-get -f install openssh-server"?
ill try it, thanks
dmx?
or x2x aka synergy
Terralthra: Thanks, ill look into them :)
it's complicated, there's a series of in-session commands, and I always forget what they're triggered by
I think?  it's ~
man ssh    i think

? I think I worded my question wrong.... I changed my /etc/ssh/ssh_config file, and I want this change to happen in the next connection. As far as I know, restarting the ssh dameon restarts the server.
oh, ssh re-reads the config files
like we're confused because we find this pretty obvious, sorry I didn't know what to say
raylu: sorry, im rather new to servers.... Thanks, though
no I just get jaded over time and forget that long time ago when I learned this all
I see.
oh, happens all the time :P    what  does "file elite.htm" have to say about its content?
its like this matrix thing, my first assumption was that some stupid immature kid hacked me and wanted to brag, but that didnt seem right
